official_title: A bill entitled, the "American Arts Gold Medallion Amendments of 1985".
short_title: American Arts Gold Medallion Amendments of 1985

summary.text: American Arts Gold Medallion Amendments of 1985 - Amends the American Arts Gold Medallion Act to require the Secretary of the Treasury, during the ten calendar years beginning after enactment of this Act, to strike and sell to the public gold medallions commemorating Arthur Miller, Georgia O'Keefe, Ella Fitzgerald, I.M. Pei, William Faulkner, Ansel Adams, Emily Dickinson, Buddy Holly, George Gershwin, Ernest Hemingway, Aaron Copland, John James Audubon, Thomas Hart Benton, Henry Fonda, Charles Marion Russell, Bix Beiderbecke, Duke Ellington, Henry David Thoreau, Will Rogers, and Paul Robeson.

titles.title: American Arts Gold Medallion Amendments of 1985
